ptolemy.vergil.debugger

Class BreakpointConfigurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ptolemy.gui.Query
              • ptolemy.vergil.debugger.BreakpointConfigurer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, ChangeListener

    public class BreakpointConfigurer
extends Query
implements ChangeListener
    A GUI widget for configuring breakpoints. This class is an editor to configure the breakpoints of an actor in an SDF model. The user can set breakpoints before or after iterate().

    There is further documentation in the package summary.

    Since:
    Ptolemy II 2.1
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Elaine Cheong, Contributor: Christopher Brooks
    See Also:
    PortConfigurerDialog, Serialized Form
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (celaine)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (celaine)

    • Field Detail

      • _firingEventTypeLabels

        protected static java.lang.String[] _firingEventTypeLabels
        Firing event type labels. To add firing events for debugging, you must make changes in 2 places in this file: _firingEventTypeLabels, _firingEventTypes Labels of FiringEventTypes to show in the dialog box.

      • _firingEventTypes

        protected static FiringEvent.FiringEventType[] _firingEventTypes
        FiringEventTypes that the user can set breakpoints on.

      • changeExecuted

        public void changeExecuted(ChangeRequest change)
        React to a change request has been successfully executed. This method is called after a change request has been executed successfully.
        Specified by:
        changeExecuted in interface ChangeListener
        Parameters:
        change - The change that has been executed, or null if the change was not done via a ChangeRequest.

      • changeFailed

        public void changeFailed(ChangeRequest change,
                         java.lang.Exception exception)
        React to a change request has resulted in an exception. This method is called after a change request was executed, but during the execution an exception was thrown.
        Specified by:
        changeFailed in interface ChangeListener
        Parameters:
        change - The change that was attempted or null if the change was not done via a ChangeRequest.
        exception - The exception that resulted.
